comment: Research-Optimized DSI Studio Configuration with Explicit Parameters

FIBER_TRACKING_QUALITY.fa_threshold: 0.05 = Stop tracking when FA drops below 0.05 (white matter boundary)
FIBER_TRACKING_QUALITY.turning_angle: 60° = Maximum angle change allowed per step (prevents unrealistic curves)
FIBER_TRACKING_QUALITY.step_size: 0.5mm = Distance between tracking steps (smaller = more accurate but slower)
FIBER_TRACKING_QUALITY.max_length: 300mm = Stop fibers longer than 300mm (prevents runaway tracking)

WHY_THESE_VALUES.fa_threshold_0.05: Standard in literature - distinguishes white/gray matter
WHY_THESE_VALUES.turning_angle_60: Anatomically plausible - allows curves but prevents loops
WHY_THESE_VALUES.step_size_0.5: Good balance: accurate but not too slow (typical: 0.25-1.0mm)
WHY_THESE_VALUES.min_length_30: Filters out noise while keeping short association fibers
WHY_THESE_VALUES.max_length_300: Captures long tracts (corpus callosum ~120mm) with safety margin

TRACKING_PERFORMANCE.quality_improvement: Much better sampling of weak connections
TRACKING_PERFORMANCE.memory_usage: Higher RAM usage but manageable on modern systems

PARAMETER_EXPLANATIONS.study_consistency: Use same parameters across all subjects in your study!
